__TOC__


The manual tests written as part of the hackfest are utilized for manul testing efforts throughout the cycle.

=== Setting up the tools ===
==== Launchpad ====
Before you begin make sure you have a launchpad profile, and your machine is setup to work with bzr and launchpad. <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/ContributingTestcases/Launchpad|This tutorial]]</nowiki> will make sure you are all set.

=== Preparing yourself ===

If you want to get started in advance of the fest, check out the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/ContributingTestcases/Manual|tutorial for writing manual testcases]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/ContributingTestcases/ManualStyleGuide|the style guide]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/TestCaseFormat#contribute|the manual testcase format]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/ContributingTestcases/ManualStyleGuide/test_case_format_script | the manual testcase check script]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-manual-tests/|project itself on launchpad]]</nowiki>.

Once you have a background on how tests work, you can view the specific hackfest page itself linked from the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Hackfest|hackfest page]]</nowiki> to pick and plan the work items you wish to tackle during the hackfest.
